PC deleted PC not paired PC not found Provided PC is not valid Provided App is not valid
Help Viewer Loading help page…
Align Left Align Center Align Right
Online Offline Refreshing View All Apps Legacy Pair OTP Pair Unpair Send Wake-On-LAN request Delete PC Test Network Connection View Details NVIDIA GameStream End-of-Service Go to Server Config Cannot open server config page, cannot find server address.
Testing Network Connection RGPClient is testing your network connection to determine if any required ports are blocked.

This may take a few seconds… Network Test Complete Your network does not appear to be blocking RGPClient. If you still have trouble connecting, check your PC's firewall settings.

If you are trying to stream over the Internet, install the RGPClient Internet Hosting Tool on your PC and run the included Internet Streaming Tester to check your PC's Internet connection. The network test could not be performed because none of RGPClient's connection testing servers were reachable. Check your Internet connection or try again later. Your device's current network connection seems to be blocking RGPClient. Streaming over the Internet may not work while connected to this network.

The following network ports were blocked:
 Your device's current network connection is blocking RGPClient. Streaming over the Internet may not work while connected to this network.
Pairing… Pair PC Do you really want to pair with %s? Please do not pair with any unfamiliar computers. Computer is offline Computer is currently in a game. You must close the game before pairing. Pairing Please enter the following PIN on the target PC: If your host PC is running Sunshine, navigate to the Sunshine web UI to enter the PIN. Pairing, please wait… OTP pairing is only available with Apollo, enter the PIN you just provided on the web UI manually if you're using other host software. Incorrect PIN or Passphrase Pairing failed Pairing already in progress Passphrase Pin must be 4 digits long Passphrase must be at least 4 characters long
Computer is online Unable to wake PC because there is no stored MAC address Waking PC… It may take a few seconds for your PC to wake up. If it doesn't, make sure it's configured properly for Wake-On-LAN.
Failed to send Wake-On-LAN packets
Unpairing… Unpaired successfully Failed to unpair Device was not paired
Computer is offline The ComputerManager service is not running. Please wait a few seconds or restart the app. Failed to resolve host GFE returned an HTTP 404 error. Make sure your PC is running a supported GPU. Using remote desktop software can also cause this error. Try rebooting your machine or reinstalling GFE.
Video Decoder Crashed RGPClient has crashed due to an incompatibility with this device's video decoder. Try adjusting the streaming settings if the crashes continue. Video Settings Reset Your device's video decoder continues to crash at your selected streaming settings. Your streaming settings have been reset to default. USB access is prohibited by your device administrator. Check your Knox or MDM settings. Your current launcher does not allow for creating pinned shortcuts. Video decoder failed to initialize. Your device may not support the selected resolution or frame rate. No video received from host. Your network connection isn't performing well. Reduce your video bitrate setting or try a faster connection. Something went wrong on your host PC when starting the stream.

Make sure you don't have any DRM-protected content open on your host PC. You can also try restarting your host PC. The host PC reported a fatal video encoding error.

Try disabling HDR mode, changing the streaming resolution, or changing your host PC's display resolution. Check your firewall and port forwarding rules for port(s):
Establishing Connection Starting connection Warning: Your active network connection is metered! Average frame decoding latency: hardware decoder latency: Average hardware decoding latency: Starting Connection Error Failed to start Connection Terminated The connection was terminated. Error code:
IP address of host PC Searching for host PCs on your local network…

 Ensure Sunshine is running on your host PC or GameStream is enabled in the GeForce Experience SHIELD settings. Yes No Lost connection to PC Details Help Are you sure you want to delete this PC? Slow connection to PC
Reduce your bitrate Poor connection to PC Video stream: %1$s %2$.2f FPS Decoder: %1$s Incoming frame rate from network: %1$.2f FPS Rendering frame rate: %1$.2f FPS Host processing latency min/max/average: %1$.1f/%2$.1f/%3$.1f ms Frames dropped by your network connection: %1$.2f%% Average network latency: %1$d ms (variance: %2$d ms) Average decoding time: %1$.2f ms
Connecting to PC… Resume Session Start in Virtual Display Start in Primary Display Quit Session Quit Current Game and Start Quit Current Game and Start in Virtual Display Quit Current Game and Start in Primary Display Cancel View Details Create Shortcut Add to Channel Hide App App List Refreshing apps… Error Failed to get app list Quitting Successfully quit Failed to quit Are you sure you want to quit the running app? All unsaved data will be lost. App ID:
Add PC Manually Connecting to the PC… Unable to connect to the specified computer. Make sure the required ports are allowed through the firewall. Successfully added computer Unable to resolve PC address. Make sure you didn't make a typo in the address. You must enter an IP address That address doesn't look right. You must use your router's public IP address for streaming over the Internet.
General Settings Video Settings Video resolution Increase to improve image clarity. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices and slower networks. Native Resolution Warning Native resolution and/or FPS may not be supported by the streaming server. You will probably need to configure a matching custom display mode for the host PC manually.

If you choose to create a custom resolution in NVIDIA Control Panel to match your screen settings, please ensure you have read and understood NVIDIA's warning regarding possible monitor damage, PC instability, and other potential problems.

We are not responsible for any problems resulting from creating a custom resolution on your PC.

It may be that your monitor does not support a necessary display configuration. If so, you may try to set up a virtual monitor. Finally, if your device or host PC does not support streaming at a specific resolution or refresh rate, you're out of luck unfortunately. Video frame rate Increase for a smoother video stream. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices. Video bitrate Increase for better image quality. Decrease to improve performance on slower connections. Video bitrate on metered networks High bitrates consume more data, lower bitrates improve smoothness in metered networks.
Set 0 for ¼ of the above bitrate settings. Mbps Resolution Scale Factor Server side requested virtual screen resolution will be multiplied by this factor. Streaming resolution are not affected.
e.g. 120% will make 2000x1000 become 2400x1200.
Setting a higher scale factor will improve image quality for some games.
Requires Apollo to take effect. Native Native Full-Screen (Landscape) (Portrait) Custom FPS Native FPS Warning Auto Invert Resolution Automatically invert the width and height of the video stream when in portrait mode.
For example: 1920x1080 will become 1080x1920. Video Scale Mode Select between Fit, Fill and Stretch Fit Fill Stretch
Audio Settings Surround sound configuration Enable 5.1 or 7.1 surround sound for home-theater systems Enable system equalizer support Allows audio effects to function while streaming, but may increase audio latency
Gamepad Settings Automatic gamepad presence detection Unchecking this option forces a gamepad to always be present Emulate rumble support with vibration Vibrates your device to emulate rumble if your gamepad does not support it Adjust emulated rumble intensity Amplify or reduce the vibration intensity on your device % Adjust analog stick deadzone Positive values set a normal dead zone, negative values apply dead zone compensation. Ensure your controller can adjust dead zones when using dead zone compensation, or centering may be difficult. % Xbox 360/One/NintendoPro USB gamepad driver Enables a built-in USB driver for devices without native Xbox/Nintendo Pro controller support Override native Xbox gamepad support Use RGPClient's USB driver for all supported gamepads, even if native Xbox/Nintendo Pro controller support is present Mouse emulation via gamepad Long pressing the Start button will switch the gamepad into mouse mode Flip face buttons Switches the face buttons A/B and X/Y for gamepads and the on-screen controls Always control mouse with touchpad Forces gamepad touchpad input to control the host mouse, even when emulating a gamepad with a touchpad. Allow use of gamepad motion sensors Enables supported hosts to request motion sensor data when emulating a gamepad with motion sensors. Disabling may slightly reduce power and network usage if motion sensors are not being used in game. Emulate gamepad motion sensor support Uses your device's built-in motion sensors if gamepad sensors are not supported by your connected gamepad or your Android version.
Note: Enabling this option may cause your gamepad to appear as a PlayStation controller on the host. Always use device's motion sensors Enforce using devices's built-in motion sensor even when the controller reported motion sensors are supported.
Input Settings Use the touchscreen as a trackpad If enabled, the touchscreen acts like a trackpad. If disabled, the touchscreen directly controls the mouse cursor. Remote desktop mouse mode This can make mouse acceleration behave more naturally for remote desktop usage, but it is incompatible with many games. Enable back and forward mouse buttons Enabling this option may break right clicking on some buggy devices
On-screen Controls Settings Show on-screen controls Show virtual controller overlay on touchscreen Hide OSC when using Controller Hide OSC when a physical controller is connected Enable vibration Vibrates your device to emulate rumble for the on-screen controls Only show L3 and R3 Hide all virtual buttons except L3 and R3 Show Guide Button Show the guide button on screen Clear saved on-screen controls layout Resets all on-screen controls to their default size and position Reset Layout Are you sure you want to delete your saved on-screen controls layout? On-screen controls reset to default Change opacity of on-screen controls Make the on-screen controls more/less transparent Change opacity %
UI Settings Enable Picture-in-Picture observer mode Allows the stream to be viewed (but not controlled) while multitasking Language Language to use for RGPClient Use small box art Smaller box art in the app grid allows more apps to be visible on screen
Host Settings Optimize game settings Allow GFE to modify game settings for optimal streaming Play audio on PC Play audio from the computer and this device
Advanced Settings Unlock all possible frame rates Streaming at 90 or 120 FPS may reduce latency on high-end devices but can cause lag or instability on devices that can't support it Allow refresh rate reduction Lower display refresh rates can save power at the expense of some additional video latency Disable warning messages Disable on-screen connection warning messages while streaming Never drop frames May reduce micro-stuttering on some devices, but can increase latency Change codec settings Newer codecs can lower video bandwidth requirements if your device supports them. Codec selections may be ignored if not supported by the host software or GPU. Enable HDR (Experimental) Stream HDR when the game and PC GPU support it. HDR requires a GPU with HEVC Main 10 encoding support. Force full range video (Experimental) This will cause loss of detail in light and dark areas if your device doesn't properly display full range video content. Show performance stats while streaming Display real-time stream performance information while streaming Show latency message after streaming Display a latency information message after the stream ends
Help Setup guide View instructions on how to set up your gaming PC for streaming Troubleshooting guide View tips for diagnosing and fixing common streaming issues Privacy policy View RGPClient's privacy policy Custom Keys help Instructions about how to setup custom special keys
Gamepad type may be changed due to motion sensor emulation
360p 480p 720p 1080p 1440p 4K
30 FPS 60 FPS 90 FPS 120 FPS
Stereo 5.1 Surround Sound 7.1 Surround Sound
Automatic (Recommended) Prefer AV1 (Experimental) Prefer HEVC Prefer H.264
Video frame pacing Specify how to balance video latency and smoothness Warp Drive (Experimental) Warp 2 (Experimental) Prefer lowest latency Balanced Balanced with FPS limit Prefer smoothest video (may significantly increase latency)
RGPClient Physical keyboard Only used when physical keyboard shortcut were intercepted by system. In some systems, several keyboard shortcut are defind and used by the Android system, causing them not being able to be passed through to the host PC. RGPClient will not look through your input, nor collecting your password, credit card number or any other private information.
Show soft keyboard Toggle Performance Overlay Select Mouse mode Enable Pan/Zoom Disable Pan/Zoom Rotate Screen Toggle Special keyss Toggle On-screen controller Toggle On-screen full keyboard Switch touch sensitivity
Enable Controller Mouse Emulation Disable Controller Mouse Emulation Disconnect Cancel Open Task Manager Send special keys ESC F11 Alt + F4 Ctrl + V Win (Meta) Win + D ALT + B Win + X ~ U + S (Sleep) Win + X ~ U + R (Reboot) Win + X ~ U + U (Power Off) Win + X ~ U + I (Log Out) Win + G (Xbox Game Bar) Ctrl + Alt + Tab Shift + Tab (Steam Overlay) Alt + Enter Win + shift + left (Move app between Desktops) Ctrl+Alt+Shift+Q (PC Exit Streaming) Ctrl+Alt+Shift+F1 (Switch Monitor) Ctrl+Alt+Shift+F12 (Switch Monitor)
Use an analog stick to scroll Select an analog stick to scroll when in mouse emulation mode None (both sticks move the mouse) Right analog stick Left analog stick
%1$dms %1$.2fms %1$.2f%% %1$s %1$.2f Decoder: %1$s Import keyboard layout Export keyboard layout This will overwrite the current layout. Export the current keyboard layout Custom bitrate Enter bitrate manually.
Can exceed the maximum range of the seekbar. Enter bitrate in Mbps. Round to 0.5. Custom refresh rate Enter refresh rate manually. Only supports Apollo. Enter refresh rate in Hz. Can be fractional. Touchscreen Mode Select between MultiTouch/SingleTouch/Trackpad/Disabled mode.
Pen/Stylus are still usable when Disabled is selected.
Forced to Track Pad(Natural) mode when useing external display.
Use local mouse cursor Default external physical mouse cursor will be captured, this option can display Android system cursor Official Virtual Gamepad Skin If you still like the old style of official virtual gamepad buttons, you can select this option.
Button shapes can be square if you selected the bottom virtual button [Normal buttons are square buttons] Enable Lite mode Display simplified performance information: Network Speed / Latency / Decode / Packet Loss Rate / FPS Lite mode click to pop up quick options Replace the back button logic, pop up the game quick menu. Virtual Trackpad Settings Back Menu When enabled, clicking the physical back button on the streaming interface will show related options!
Soft keyboard, performance information, touch mode switching, send special keys Set the resolution and exit the settings page to take effect! Add a custom resolution, separated by x, strange resolutions may not work.
For example: 1920x1080
If it is a non-native resolution, it may not fill the notch area by default. If the aspect ratio is the same, you can manually set to stretch the screen to fill the full screen Custom Resolution Auto Orientation The streaming screen will be displayed according to the device's orientation when the stream begins. Import Custom Keys Available in Back Menu and special keys.
Note: Importing will overwrite current configuration, please backup accordingly. Software Update RGPClient Version by ZeronX - Visit GitHub Release to get latest version Special Key Layout Display virtual keys on screen Display a layer of virtual special keys on the touchscreen.
Key opacity is shared with the virtual gamepad above. Default layout profile Each layout profile is initially the same (generated based on the keyboards.json file), you can delete and adjust it yourself When you click the screen button, it will trigger the phone motor vibration. This option can also be used for virtual gamepad buttons. Normal buttons are square buttons Virtual button shapes are square buttons, by default they are round. Reset virtual keyboard layout Initialize the special key layout (reset the default selected layout scheme) Compatible with Switch JoyCon If your JoyCon cannot be used or has key recognition issues, you can try to enable this feature. Adapted for Android 10 and above Virtual Full Keyboard Opacity Virtual Full Keyboard Height Virtual Full Keyboard Width Virtual Full Keyboard Align Mode Adjust the height of the virtual full keyboard Adjust the width of the virtual full keyboard How the virtual full keyboard aligns to the view port Free Analog Stick Virtual gamepad left and right stick center point positions are not fixed, can be freely adjusted within a certain range of movement. By default, only when the stick moves, the background is displayed. If you don't like it, you can adjust the opacity effect. Free Analog Stick Background Opacity External Display Mode (Beta) Stream display on the monitor, virtual buttons and performance information and other controls on the phone screen. Display in Top Center Streaming picture will be aligned to the top of the screen instead of centered when resolution is not native. Touch Screen Sensitivity When enabled, you can manually adjust the touch sensitivity. Touch Screen Sensitivity Global Effect By default not selected, only effective on the right half of the screen (suitable for playing Genshin Impact), selected to be effective within the full screen range. Automatically return to screen center when touch coordinates exceed boundary Normally high sensitivity, small sliding distance will exceed the boundary, resulting in unable to move, you can select this option. Screen Sensitivity Adjustment X Axis Multi-touch mode, when playing games, some games may not meet the sensitivity adjustment needs, you can use this option to modify the sensitivity of the field of view. Screen Sensitivity Adjustment Y Axis Multi-touch mode, when playing games, some games may not meet the sensitivity adjustment needs, you can use this option to modify the sensitivity of the field of view. Debug Info Test gamepad vibration and other stuff. Touchpad Sensitivity X Axis For mouse touchpad mode and virtual special button touchpad control;
Both share a sensitivity value, but the sensitivity performance may be different.
Does anyone use both together? Touchpad Sensitivity Y Axis For mouse touchpad mode and virtual special button touchpad control;
Both share a sensitivity value, but the sensitivity performance may be different.
Does anyone use both together? Force vibration on device If you are not satisfied with the vibration of the connected gamepad, you can enable this option.
Invalid for forced use of RGPClient's built-in USB driver Disable default Special Keys If you feel the built-in commands in the Back Menu are useless, you can disable them and use your imported ones. Trackpad Sensitivity X X axis Sensitivity of the trackpad, negative to invert direction Trackpad Sensitivity Y Y axis Sensitivity of the trackpad, negative to invert direction Enable Vibration for Drag-and-Drop on Trackpad Enables vibration feedback for drag-and-drop actions on Samsung trackpad devices. Hold Duration for Drag-and-Drop Activation on Trackpad Set the duration to hold on the trackpad before activating drag-and-drop on Samsung devices. Swap X and Y axis of the trackpad input On some devices, trackpad input may be rotated in axis. Enabling this option may help. Force QWERTY layout Force use QWERTY keyboard layout.
Required by GFE.
Turn off if you want to use a different keyboard layout. Back button as Meta Send Meta(Win) key on physical back button press. Back button as Guide Send Guide(PS/HOME) button press when Back button is pressed on controllers. Ignore synthetic events Ignore synthetic events sent by the Android system. This may resolve issues where mouse clicks trigger other unexpected keys on certain devices.
Enabling this option will cause the system's soft keyboard to stop working. Smart Clipboard Sync (Experimental) Automatically upload clipboard content to server when the stream starts/resumes, download clipboard from server when losing focus(requires Apollo) Clipboard Sync Toast Show toast for clipboard sync result Hide clipboard content Mark remote clipboard as sensitive information MISC Bandwidth Network/Decoding delay Packet loss Quick Menu Wrong import format, please check! Enable battery status report for gamepad Report gamepad battery status when possible.
Disable this option might help if you experience stutter with touch screen/touch pad/stylus/mouse input occasionally. Enforce Display Mode Force surface to use the optimal display mode.
Required by some systems (such as ColorOS) to set refresh rate/resolution properly.
Do not enable on ChromeCast 4K as it might lead to bugs. Use Virtual Display Use Virtual Display by default.
Virtual Display can automatically match your client side resolution and frame rate settings, giving you a seamless streaming experience.
Requires Apollo as host streaming software. Quick Resume Do not show resume menu when clicking resume button, resume the app immediately. Sticky modifier keys Use sticky modifier keys on virtual full keyboard and custom onscreen keyboard. Hide
KBD Multi touch Absolute touch Track pad(Natural/Double tap to drag) Track pad(Gaming/Long press to drag) Disabled Absolute touch (left/right click swapped) Profile 1 Profile 2 Profile 3 Profile 4 Profile 5 Toggle local mouse cursor(physical mouse needed) Android Version: API Version: Kernel Version: Brand and Model: Has Vibration Motor No Vibration Motor Test Device Vibration (%s) Vibration Amplitude (%d) Simple Vibration for 1 Second Continuous HD Vibration Please Choose No gamepad detected, please connect a gamepad, tap refresh, and try again! No vibrator detected on the gamepad! Set Amplitude 0-255 (Effective only for HD Vibration) Name: Sensors: None (no relevant driver or gamepad not supported) No corresponding API below Android 12 VID_PID: Vibration: Supported Not Supported Details: Number of Gamepads: +Accelerometer +Gyroscope Stop Vibration Tap to refresh gamepad info Refresh gamepad list Test gamepad rumble Please enter a value between 0 and 9999. Settings saved successfully! Empty file! Import success! An error occurred: Save OSK profile Advanced Menu Really want to quit? Please make sure you have no unsaved progress. Quitting the session will terminate your current running application. Quit Session Server Commands Fetch Clipboard Upload Clipboard No Server Commands Please make sure you're using Apollo as server software and has been granted this client with "Server Command" permission. Virtual display driver isn't ready on the server. Please make sure the SudoVDA driver is installed and enabled. Virtual display isn't supported on this server. Please use <a href="https://github.com/ClassicOldSong/Apollo">Apollo</a> as the host streaming software. This server does not support clipboard sync. Please install or upgrade your server to the latest version of Apollo. Server is starting or computer is unlocking, please wait… Permission Denied Connection Timeout Launch Apps Sync Clipboard
Quản lý cấu hình Thêm cấu hình mới Tên cấu hình không được để trống Đã thêm cấu hình: %1$s Cấu hình %1$s đã tồn tại Sử dụng cấu hình này Đổi tên cấu hình Xóa cấu hình Đã chuyển sang cấu hình: %1$s Đã đổi tên cấu hình từ %1$s thành %2$s Đã xóa cấu hình: %1$s Không thể xóa cấu hình: %1$s Bạn có chắc chắn muốn xóa cấu hình %1$s? Tùy chọn nhập Ghi đè lên cấu hình hiện tại Nhập thành cấu hình mới Thêm Đổi tên Xóa
Quản lý cấu hình Gamepad Bạn có thể tạo và quản lý nhiều cấu hình gamepad khác nhau:

1. Nhấn nút Gamepad ở giữa phía trên màn hình để quản lý cấu hình
2. Nút "..." ở góc phải để xuất/nhập cấu hình
3. Cấu hình hiện tại hiển thị ở trên cùng

Mỗi cấu hình sẽ lưu vị trí và kích thước của tất cả các nút điều khiển.
